title: How to Make Sour Berry Syrup

text: Wash your hands well with soap and hot water.  Place the blackberries, blueberries, and raspberries into a large, clean bowl. Take a potato masher and start to mash the berries, stirring every few 45 seconds or so. After roughly 5 minutes, drizzle in the honey, stirring well all the while. Mash the berries for about a minute. Spritz the lemon juice into the berry mash. Whisk as much as you want, but whisk for at least 2 minutes. Inspect the syrup. Is it drippy and runny but slightly thick with a few chunks in? This is the desired consistency. Taste the syrup. Is it tangy and tart with a hint of sweetness? Perfect. If too sweet, add more lemon juice; if slightly too sour, add more honey. Over the top of the bowl in which the syrup is resting, attach cling film or foil to keep fresh. Use within 3 days.
